origin.origDate: 1763 according to Vinson (1867-1896, p. 21). See colophon U3, f36r4.

acquisition.p: Bequest of Edouard Ariel. Made first to Société Asiatique de Paris in 1855 (see Rosny 1869), transfered in 1866 to Bibliothèque Nationale.

body.p: The Tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭai is a devotional poem, dated possibly to the 7th century of the Common Era, in praise of the Tamil god Murukaṉ.The poem, attributed to Nakkīrar, belongs to the Caṅkam corpus and to the Tamil Śaiva canonical works (Tirumuṟai).
The manuscript contains the commentary by Nacciṉārkkiṉiyar. The root-text is quoted in the commentary.
Other manuscript testimonies of this text are BnF Indien 28.51 and 66.
The bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains between the two woodcovers:
U1: 1 folio (doubled folio), unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1. With shelfmark: C/22.
U3: 36 folios, (f1 not explicitly foliated) = commentary by Nacciṉārkkiṉiyar, by hand n° 2. 6 lines per page.
U5: 1 folio (doubled folio), unfoliated = guardleaf: 1 Kampar taṉippāṭal on recto, by hand n° 3; ownership statement on verso, by hand n° 4.

Paratexts: marginal benedictions; title-page; marginal chapter headers (original ones crossed-out, while others, later added, are not blackened with soot); colophon; ownership statement; addenda: benedictions (U1, f[1]r, rm); 1 Kampar taṉippāṭal (U5: f[1]r).

U1, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title-page: benediction; title; benedictions (later addition, not blackened with soot).
(f[1]r, c1) veṟṟivēl uṟṟa tuṇai
(f[1]r, c2, 1–4) tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭaikku nacciṉarkkiṉiyār urai
(f[1]r, rm1) civamayam
(f[1]r, rm1) civamayam

U3, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = incipit: marginal benediction, title, and chapter header; commentary upon first two cīrs.
(f1r, lm2, 1) veṟṟivēl uṟṟa tuṇai
(f1r, lm2, 2–3) tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭai-y urai
(f1r, lm2, 4) mutal · tirupparaṅkiri
(f1r1) Ulaka muvappa Etu: Ulakam eṉpatu mutal kaṇavaṉ eṉṉun tuṇaiyum oru toṭar – Ulakameṉpatu – (...)

U3, folio 36, verso = excipit: end of commentary; colophon.
(f36v2) (…) – murukāṟṟu-
(f36v3) ppaṭai-y eṉpataṟku vīṭu peṟutaṟku-c camaintāṉōr iravalaṉṉai vīṭu-p peṟṟāṉ oruvaṉmurukaṉ iṭattē-y Āṟṟuppaṭuttat’ eṉṟu poruḷ kū-
(f36v4) ṟuka – {pcl} tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭai muṟṟiṟṟu {pcl} cupāṉu {varuṣam} cittirai {mācam} 22{tēti} caṉikkiḻamai Eḻuti niṟai veṟiṟṟu {pcl}

U5, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = Kampar taṉippāṭal .
(f[1]r1) koṅkaiyāṉ māraṉ kulacēkarap perumāṉ ‡
(f[1]r2) poṟkaiyāṉ āṉakatai pōtatō naṟkamala ‡
(f[1]r3) maṉṟalē koṇṭēṉ maṇivāyalai yacaittaṟ ‡
(f[1]r4) teṉṟalē y-eṉceytāy ceppu ‡‡{pcl}

U5, folio 1, verso, unfoliated = ownership statement; hardly legible scribble.
(f[1]v, c1, 1) Itu pōttakam
(f[1]v, c1, 2) Eṉṉitu
"This book is mine"
(f[1]v, c2, 1) nittiyakavi ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Lacuna of unknown extent: [...].Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} =piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}.Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
